title: What can you learn from ancient poop?

multiple-choice.question: What are the fossilized remains of ancient human feces called?

options.label: A
options.text: Poopstones

options.label: B
options.text: Coprolites

options.label: C
options.text: Feces fossils

options.label: D
options.text: Turd fossils

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what can happen to a feces when it dries out?

options.label: A
options.text: It gets filled in by earth

options.label: B
options.text: It turns to stone

options.label: C
options.text: It gets preserved in a mummy's desiccated intestines

options.label: D
options.text: It gets mineralized

multiple-choice.question: If archaeologists find a fossilized feces of an ancient human, what can they infer from it?

options.label: A
options.text: The person's favorite hobby

options.label: B
options.text: The person's occupation

options.label: C
options.text: The person's diet, living conditions, and possibly their health

options.label: D
options.text: The person's favorite food

multiple-choice.question: In what way can fossilized turds help solve murder mysteries?

options.label: A
options.text: By revealing the location of the crime

options.label: B
options.text: By providing a list of suspects

options.label: C
options.text: By identifying the cause of death

options.label: D
options.text: By showing the victim's last meal

multiple-choice.question: What can be inferred from the fact that the Viking's feces contained a lot of intestinal parasites?

options.label: A
options.text: The Viking had a healthy diet

options.label: B
options.text: The Viking was a vegetarian

options.label: C
options.text: The Viking had poor hygiene and lived in unsanitary conditions

options.label: D
options.text: The Viking was very clean

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what can be concluded from the analysis of the warlord Cangrande della Scala's feces?

options.label: A
options.text: He was poisoned by his servant

options.label: B
options.text: He died of natural causes

options.label: C
options.text: He ingested a poisonous plant before he died

options.label: D
options.text: He was murdered by his enemy

multiple-choice.question: How can fossilized feces help archaeologists understand the lives of ancient humans?

options.label: A
options.text: By revealing their occupation

options.label: B
options.text: By showing their living conditions

options.label: C
options.text: By providing information about their diet

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the fact that the contents of 1-2 millennia-old coprolites in Puerto Rico backed up the archaeological evidence?

options.label: A
options.text: It confirms the presence of a new species

options.label: B
options.text: It supports the theory of evolution

options.label: C
options.text: It shows that native populations on the island at the time were two distinct cultural groups with different diets and parasites

options.label: D
options.text: It reveals the location of a lost city

multiple-choice.question: What can be inferred from the fact that the transcript mentions the warlord Cangrande della Scala's feces being preserved in his corpse's rectum?

options.label: A
options.text: The warlord was a vegetarian

options.label: B
options.text: The warlord had poor hygiene

options.label: C
options.text: The warlord's death was suspicious and likely due to foul play

options.label: D
options.text: The warlord was a clean person

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: A
options.text: The Viking was a healthy person of significance

options.label: B
options.text: The Viking's feces was a rare find

options.label: C
options.text: The Viking was a healthy person

options.label: D
options.text: The Viking was a vegetarian

options.label: C
options.text: Drying out, turning to stone, and being filled in by earth

options.text: Being filled in by earth, getting mineralized, and turning to stone
